ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, I would. Fiction writing is very difficult, but Caz will help you focus your ideas and shape your characters.
Take this class only if you are a serious writer. Though you only write two stories all semester, if you put in the work and don't write them the weekend they're due, you will become a better writer.

If you get into this class, you should take it, absolutely. Caz is great, the workload isn't enormous, and you get to exercise your creativity. The workshops are scary, but they really do make you a much better writer.
Anyone from any major should feel comfortable taking this class. Caz is honest but always constructive. His every-man approach to writing was really refreshing.

I could not recommend this class highly enough. In some ways, I suppose, it depends on who else is in your class, but Caz is an unbelievable professor - approachable, funny, helpful, and very inspiring. He takes everyone seriously but manages to maintain a very free, informal atmosphere in the classroom. The class is what I hoped for out of Creative Writing at Yale - it is all about personal growth as a writer, not about learning the rules of a craft, per se. You do not want to pass it up. Possibly my favorite class at Yale with my favorite professor at Yale.
If you like the workshop format
